Article Title: Journalist's death in UP: Priyanka says state government 'nurturing jungle raj'
Article Text: NEW DELHI: Congress leader Priyanka Gandhi Vadra on Monday hit out at the Uttar Pradesh government over the death of a journalist, who had recently run a story on the liquor mafia and was killed in what police said was a road accident. The Congress general secretary accused the Yogi Adityanath dispensation of "nurturing jungle raj".The 42-year-old news channel reporter, Sulabh Srivastava, died as his motorcycle rammed a pole near a brick kiln in Sukhpal Nagar under the Kotwali police station area of Pratapgarh on Sunday, police said."The liquor mafia from Aligarh to Pratapgarh: has caused death throughout the state. The government is silent," Priyanka Gandhi said in a tweet in Hindi."Journalists uncover the truth, warn the administration about the dangers. The government is asleep," she alleged.Does the government that is "nurturing jungle raj" have any answers for the tears of the family of journalist Sulabh Srivastava, Priyanka Gandhi asked.Srivastava had recently run a news story against the liquor mafia in the region. Then on June 12, he wrote to the Prayagraj additional director general of police to seek protection.Additional Superintendent of Police Surendra Dwivedi said Srivastava died in a crash while returning from Asrahi village under the Lalganj police station area after reporting on an illegal arms manufacturing unit uncovered there.Following the crash, a severely injured Srivastava was taken to the district hospital, where doctors declared him dead, he said.
Article Summary: Sulabh Srivastava, 42, died as his motorcycle rammed a pole near a brick kiln in Sukhpal Nagar under the Kotwali police station area of Pratapgarh on Sunday. Congress general secretary accused the Yogi Adityanath dispensation of "nurturing jungle raj"

Article Title: BJP set to contest Haryana polls on its own, declares Shah
Article Text: NEW DELHI: Undeterred by the loss of five seats during Lok Sabha polls in Haryana, senior BJP leader and home minister Amit Shah on Saturday announced that the party will contest the forthcoming assembly polls in the state solo and exhorted party workers to gear up for a two-thirds majority ."We have lost a few seats in Haryana by small margins but our vote share has gone up by 5% from 2014.This time too, we will not ally with anyone and will contest on our own and win. This time, we must win Haryana with a two-third majority," Shah said, in his first public rally after Lok Sabha polls, as he addressed BJP workers at Panchkula.The decision to go alone is significant after Congress halved BJP's tally from the state. Just before LS polls, Dushyant Chautala-led Jannayak Janta Party (JJP), which was an ally of BJP in the state, severed ties and contested the polls on its own. Shah made it clear that the party does not intend to make concessions to woo the former ally back.Shah sought to play down BJP's less-than-expected performance in LS polls , focusing instead on Narendra Modi's feat in being the first PM in 60 years to score a third consecutive victory "How can this be possible without the blessings of the people of India?" the home minister said.He said that Congress is trying to make their defeat in the Lok Sabha election look like a victory through false propaganda." BJP got 5% more votes in the last election than in the previous election. On the other hand, BJP alone has won more seats than the total number of seats won by all INDI Alliance parties," the home minister asserted.He dubbed Congress as a party of dynasts and referred to Congress leader Rahul Gandhi as "Tara" and former CM B S Hooda's son Deepender Singh Hooda as "Sitara". "Tara and Sitara cannot have their sway in Haryana. Sonia Ji's Tara and Hooda Saheb's Sitara won't shine in Haryana anymore."Sensing strong resistance from Congress after the loss of five seats in Lok Sabha polls in the state, the BJP brass has taken measures to improve the party prospects in the state polls, appointing party's key strategist Dharmendra Pradhan as poll in-charge and former Tripura CM Biplab Deb as his deputy.
Article Summary: BJP will contest the forthcoming assembly polls in the state solo and exhorted party workers to gear up for a two-thirds majority. The decision to go alone is significant after Congress halved BJP's tally from the state. Just before LS polls, Dushyant Chautala-led Jannayak Janta Party (JJP) severed ties and contested the polls on its own.

Article Title: Opposition may field SP's Faizabad MP for dy Speaker contest
Article Text: KOLKATA: Trinamool Congress , Samajwadi Party and Congress are exploring the option of projecting SP's Faizabad MP Awadhesh Prasad as INDIA bloc 's deputy Speaker candidate. Prasad (78) is a Dalit who won the unreserved seat that covers Ayodhya. This comes amid reports that Congress was keen to have K Suresh - an eight-time MP from Kerala - as opposition bloc's deputy speaker pick.TMC general secretary Abhishek Banerjee, Samajwadi president Akhilesh Yadav and Lok Sabha leader of opposition Rahul Gandhi have already discussed this and are likely to take it up with other allies, said sources.The sources added the nomination of Prasad was an idea of West Bengal chief minister and TMC chief Mamata Banerjee, who conveyed it to nephew Abhishek.According to sources, the three INDIA bloc senior partners seemed to agree that Prasad would be an "out-of-the-box" candidate and his nomination would carry "strong symbolism" as he won the high-stakes contest by over 50,000 votes.While conferring with Rahul and Akhilesh, Abhishek suggested that choosing INDIA bloc's deputy Speaker pick should "send out a strong message", said sources. He focused on symbolism since numbers don't stack up for INDIA bloc if there is a contest.A Trinamool MP said: "INDIA bloc will contest for the deputy Speaker's post. In the remaining three days of this session... even later... we will collectively demand the post. A consensus is being worked out on possible nominees."Article 93 of the Constitution says the Lok Sabha "shall choose two of its members as Speaker and deputy Speaker". The 17th LS was the first since Independence which didn't have a deputy Speaker.Asked about the situation in which NDA didn't accept the opposition's proposal of a deputy speaker election, the TMC MP added: "The 17th Lok Sabha and the 18th Lok Sabha are very different. There's an NDA govt now, not a BJP govt. We will continue to aggressively push for the election in this session and all following sessions."
Article Summary: TMC general secretary Abhishek Banerjee, Samajwadi president Akhilesh Yadav and Lok Sabha leader of opposition Rahul Gandhi have already discussed this. Prasad (78) is a Dalit who won the unreserved seat that covers Ayodhya.

Article Title: Chennai Customs Officer Faces Corruption Charges for Bribery Demand
Article Text: CHENNAI: The Central Bureau Of investigation ( CBI ) has booked a 29-year-old preventive officer of the Chennai customs for demanding Rs 2,000 to clear imported goods.The Prevention of Corruption Act was invoked against Manish Mittal --a group III officer posted at customs house on Rajaji Salai -- based on the complaint of Suresh of Mirthikashree Enterprises.According to the FIR, the firm imported 25 metric tonne of 2mm clear glass from China. The consignment reached Chennai port on May 19. While the clearance from customs was handed over to a third-party licence holder, it was not cleared by customs stating that a case was pending against the importer.Even after the complainant clarified that he had been acquitted from the case and submitted relevant documents, the papers were shuttled between officers. The superintendent (docks intelligence unit) allegedly informed the complainant that the consignment should be subjected to tests in the lab.When Suresh approached Manish Mittal again, he allegedly demanded Rs 2,000 to take up the file for verification again. Based on Suresh's complaint, the CBI initiated an inquiry and confirmed the commission of offence based on the recorded conversation between the accused and the complainant at the Customs House on June 4.The complaint was forwarded to the state govt. With the state govt’s ascent, the CBI registered a case against Manish Mittal.
Article Summary: CBI booked a 29-year-old preventive officer of the Chennai customs for demanding Rs 2,000 to clear imported goods. The Prevention of Corruption Act was invoked against Manish Mittal based on the complaint of Suresh of Mirthikashree Enterprises.

Article Title: Not necessary that every Ram Bhakt will vote for BJP: Former Madhya Pradesh CM Uma Bharti
Article Text: BHOPAL: Former Madhya Pradesh chief minister Uma Bharti on Saturday said that it is not necessary that every " Ram Bhakt " should vote for BJP Bharti was in MP's Shivpuri, speaking with mediapersons on BJP's poor performance in Uttar Pradesh, when she said: "BJP's defeat in UP and Ayodhya is not such a big issue. It should not be interpreted as Hindu voters being angry with BJP.You have to understand the mind of Hindu society. Hindus do not think that religion and social order are one, but the Muslim society does."She went on to add: "No one should manifest the arrogance that every Ram Bhakt will vote for BJP. The voter may have voted for anyone but his devotion for Lord Ram has not decreased. And neither should Prime Minister Narendra Modi or chief minister Yogi Adityanath be blamed (for the results)."The Ram Janmabhoomi leader argued that the issue of Mathura and Kashi have no connection with the defeat in UP. “When the Babri structure was demolished on Dec 6, then too we lost Uttar Pradesh. But Ayodhya remained on BJP’s agenda. So will these (Mathura and Kashi). The Ram Mandir issue has its own place while victory and defeat have a separate standing. You should not connect both,” she said.It should also not be interpreted that since BJP lost in Ayodhya, people do not have faith in Lord Ram, she remarked, adding: “Lord Ram is everything for all Sanatanis. Lord Ram is the Universe. That is why one should keep election results away from Ram Mandir.”Asked why BJP failed to achieve its 400-plus target, Bharti said, “Ask Jagat Prakash Nadda about this. So far as I am concerned, I wanted BJP to cross 500.”
Article Summary: Former Madhya Pradesh chief minister Uma Bharti on Saturday said that it is not necessary that every " Ram Bhakt " should vote for BJP. She was speaking with mediapersons on BJP's poor performance in Uttar Pradesh. The Ram Janmabhoomi leader argued that the issue of Mathura and Kashi have no connection with the defeat in UP.

Article Title: National Rally seen winning 37% of popular vote in first round of French snap election
Article Text: PARIS: An opinion poll published in newspaper Les Echos on Friday said French far-right party National Rally (NR) further rose in its forecast and may reach as much as 37% of the popular vote, two days before the first voting round in parliamentary elections .NR was up by 2% from the last publication of the poll compiled by OpinionWay a week ago, while Macron 's centrist bloc Together poll was seen reaching 20%, down by 2% from the last publication.The New Popular Front left-wing alliance was seen reaching 28% of the vote, a level unchanged versus a week ago.OpinionWay made no seat projections for France's next national assembly which, due to the two-round majority voting system, could differ significantly from the measured popular vote.BFM TV, in a different poll compiled by Elabe, said RN could potentially cross the 289-seat bar for an absolute majority, placing the party and its allies in a 260-295 seats range.The final outcome will be known after a second round of voting on July 7 and is hard to predict at the current stage as it will largely depend on to what extend RN's rivals will team up and withdraw own runoff candidates to block the far right.Prime minister Gabriel Attal on Thursday accused RN leader Jordan Bardella of tolerating racist speech in the ranks of his far-right camp amid a heated last television debate before the vote, an accusation Bardella rejected.
Article Summary: French far-right party National Rally (NR) may reach as much as 37% of the popular vote. NR was up by 2% from the last publication of the poll compiled by OpinionWay a week ago. Macron's centrist bloc Together poll was seen reaching 20%, down by 2%.
